titleStmt.title: John Bissell to James W. Tate
CWG2720

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p: Commissioner to take testimony and acknowledgments for all the States in the Union: appointed by the Governors thereof.

NOTARY PUBLIC,
11 Wall-st., (Mortimer Building,)
New York.

28th February 1862
Hon J W Tate
Sir

Yours of Oct 15th respecting a renewal of my commission as Commissioner of Deeds &c for Kentucky was duly received, & would have been answered sooner but for the fact that so little business in the line of these appointments has been doing for the last year that I felt reluctant to spare from my limited means -- the trifling fee required on such renewal. For Kentucky I have done nothing for months, & the prospect for future business is gloomy in the extreme -- & still I desire to retain the power & authority confered by the appointment in hope that in future it may be made available to the citizens of each state & therefore now enclose you the
fee & respectfully solicit a renewal of the office

New York
Comr of Deeds
Jno. Bissell
City
Appd. Mar. 5th 1862
